description: Basic GDPR concepts for privacy policy generation (not legal advice)

overview.applies: Organizations processing personal data of EU residents

keyPrinciples.lawfulness: Data must be processed lawfully, fairly, and transparently
keyPrinciples.purpose: Collected for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes
keyPrinciples.minimization: Collect only data that is necessary
keyPrinciples.accuracy: Keep data accurate and up to date
keyPrinciples.storage: Keep data only as long as necessary

dataSubjectRights.access: Right to access their personal data
dataSubjectRights.erasure: Right to deletion ('right to be forgotten')
dataSubjectRights.portability: Right to receive data in portable format

privacyPolicyRequirements: Identity and contact details of controller
Contact details of Data Protection Officer (if applicable)
Purposes and legal basis for processing
Whether provision of data is statutory or contractual requirement
disclaimer: This information is for general educational purposes only and does not constitute legal advice. Consult a qualified legal professional for GDPR compliance.
